newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Buba gold row, not French vote, key for Belgian OLOs.
newsitem.headline: Buba gold row, not French vote, key for Belgian OLOs.

text.p: The row between the Bundesbank and the Bonn government over the revaluation of gold reserves will set the tone for Belgian linear bonds (OLOs) and futures in the days ahead, traders said on Monday.
"The hot issue for the next few days is the gold row," one trader said.
The Left's victory in Sunday's French elections by contrast was no longer considered a major factor as it had already been largely discounted, traders said.
At 0758 GMT the benchmark 2007 OLO yielded 6.03 percent, up from 6.02 percent at the close on Friday.
One trader said prices were all set to advance.
